Box 177 Bar Harbor ME 04609 acad_gis@nps.gov US 207-288-8724 207-288-8709 8-4:30 Eastern time, M-F, excluding Federal holidays Acadia National Park Acadia National Park ACAD_HikingTrails_2018 Created to document the location of the hiking trail system of Acadia National Park. Used for planning, cartography, compliance.

Contains lines representing the trail system in Acadia National Park as of 201801.

Credit the National Park Service when using this data. Geographic Information System (GIS) national parks & reserves National Park Service trails pedestrians recreation hiking Trails transportation

OK on maps for the public.

date of currency; date of last update completion 2018-01-31T00:00:00 external fe63e826116cfd2e74c2fadc99e05b2a K. Anderson Acadia National Park GIS Specialist 207-288-8724 2047-288-8709 P.O. Box 177 Bar Harbor Maine 04609 US karen_b_anderson@nps.gov 0800-1630 M-F True K. Anderson

The National Park Service shall not be held liable for improper or incorrect use of the data described and/or contained herein. These data and related graphics (i.e. "GIF or JPG" format files) are not legal documents and are not intended to be used as such. The information contained in these data is dynamic and may change over time. The data are not better than the original sources from which they were derived. It is the responsibility of the data user to use the data appropriately and consistent within the limitations of geospatial data in general and these data in particular. The related graphics are intended to aid the data user in acquiring relevant data; it is not appropriate to use the related graphics as data. The National Park Service gives no warranty, expressed or implied, as to the accuracy, reliability, or completeness of these data. It is strongly recommended that these data are directly acquired from an NPS server and not indirectly through other sources which may have changed the data in some way. Although these data have been processed successfully on computer systems at the National Park Service, no warranty expressed or implied is made regarding the utility of the data on other systems for general or scientific purposes, nor shall the act of distribution constitute any such warranty. This disclaimer applies both to individual use of the data and aggregate use with other data.

Microsoft Windows 7 Version 6.1 (Build 7601) Service Pack 1; Esri ArcGIS 10.5.0.6491 1 -68.660352 -68.043955 44.400965 44.003402 usually done annually EPSG 6.13(3.0.1) ACAD_HikingTrails_2018 Attribute Table None Feature Class 434 FID FID OID 4 0 0 Internal feature number. Esri Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated. Shape Shape Geometry 0 0 0 Feature geometry. ESRI Coordinates defining the features. TRAILTYPE 25 25 String Description of the current status or designation of the trail. K.Anderson, GIS Specialist TRAILTYPE 0 0 Existing/Maintained This hiking trail is marked and maintained for public use by the NPS inside the park boundary. K.Anderson, GIS Specialist Non-Park Trail-Existing This hiking trail is marked and maintained for public use by the NPS, under agreement, though it is outside the park boundary. K.Anderson, GIS Specialist TRAILNAME 50 50 String Too many unique values. Name of the trail according to Acadia National Park's trail crew and current signage. K.Anderson, GIS Specialist TRAILNAME 0 0 INPARK 2 2 String Y Yes, the trail falls within Acadia National Park K.Anderson, GIS Specialist N No, the trail does not fall within Acadia National Park. K.Anderson, GIS Specialist Is the trail within Acadia National Park K.Anderson, GIS Specialist INPARK 0 0 INTENDUSE 12 12 String pedestrian This trail is intended to be used only by pedestrians. K.Anderson, GIS Specialist mixed This trail is intended to be used by pedestrian and other users. K.Anderson, GIS Specialist equestrian This trail is intended to be used by equestrians (horseback riders). K.Anderson, GIS Specialist bicycle This trail is intended to be used by bicyclists. K.Anderson, GIS Specialist snowmobile This trail may be used by snowmobiles. K.Anderson, GIS Specialist What is the intended use of this trail? K.Anderson, GIS Specialist INTENDUSE 0 0 MAINTBY 20 20 String NPS National Park Service maintains this trail. K.Anderson, GIS Specialist VIS A villiage improvement society maintains this trail. K.Anderson, GIS Specialist FOA The non-profit group Friends of Acadia maintains this trail. K.Anderson, GIS Specialist JPH Consessioner The consession operator for Jordan Pond House maintaines this trail. K.Anderson, GIS Specialist unknown we don't know who maintains this trail. K.Anderson, GIS Specialist [blank] same as unknown K.Anderson, GIS Specialist What organization maintains this trail? K.Anderson, GIS Specialist MAINTBY 0 0 SURFACE 12 12 String hardened the surface of this trail is hardened with concrete or asphalt K.Anderson, GIS Specialist unhardened the surface of this trail is not hardened with concrete or asphalt K.Anderson, GIS Specialist does this trail have a hardened or unhardened surface K.Anderson, GIS Specialist SURFACE 0 0 TC_LENGTH TC_LENGTH Double 19 Length of the TRAIL SECTION of which this line segment is a part, in miles, according to the Acadia National Park Trail Crew's database; this is the number used on the trail signs in the park. PLEASE NOTE: you should not sum on this field because, if there are multiple arcs making up a section, you'll count it twice! K.Anderson, GIS Specialist 0 2.7 miles 0.1 0 0 MapCOLOR MapCOLOR String 30 Anemone Violet K.Anderson, GIS Specialist one of 5 colors used for existing/maintained trails that fall inside of NPS boundaries; HSV values 284-100-90 Seville Orange K.Anderson, GIS Specialist one of 5 colors used for existing/maintained trails that fall inside of NPS boundaries; HSV values 40-100-90 Lapis Lazuli K.Anderson, GIS Specialist one of 5 colors used for existing/maintained trails that fall inside of NPS boundaries; HSV values 216-100-90 Leaf Green K.Anderson, GIS Specialist one of 5 colors used for existing/maintained trails that fall inside of NPS boundaries; HSV values 100-100-66 Poinsetta Red K.Anderson, GIS Specialist one of 5 colors used for existing/maintained trails that fall inside of NPS boundaries; HSV values 0-100-90 Light Vert used for existing/maintained trails that fall OUTside of NPS boundaries; HSV values 159-50-96 K.Anderson, GIS Specialist Color used on master map for Trail Crew at Acadia NP, from ArcGIS-ArcMap color palette. Gives a 6-color depiction with each named trail in a color different from the other trails it touches. K.Anderson, GIS Specialist 0 0 Shape_Leng Shape_Leng Double 19 0 0 dataset 434 SimpleFALSE434TRUEFALSE 20180208
